a free technology camp for non profits

3401 Webberville Road

node-2.text: What is the structure for the day?

node-3.text: Bar Camp aka Open Source Technology
Select some core issues/topics that will be presented multiple times during the day.

node-4.text: No longer than 15 or 30 mins in length,
Allows people multiple opportunities to learn of and about a broad array of resources, tools, and skills with which they may not be familiar with.

node-3.text: When and how will the day's results be reported?

node-2.text: Will there be breaks other than lunch to provide networking opportunities?

node-3.text: What about structured games/activities that enable and support fun and valuable networking?

node-3.text: Are there key content guidelines that need to be followed by SMEs?

node-4.text: Emphasis is on providing free, open source resources and tools.

node-0.text: Phrases = Group of related words that do not include a subject and verb

node-1.text: Prepositional Phrase = a preposition + noun or pronoun
Appositive Phrase = renaming or amplifying a word immediately preceeding

node-2.text: My favourite music, Gregorian chant, is playing.

node-1.text: Particple Phrase = verbals ending in -ing or -ed + complements or modifiers, and acting as an ADJECTIVE.

node-2.text: Working around the clock, the firefighters put out the fire

node-1.text: Gerund Phrase = verbals that end in -ing and that act as nouns

node-2.text: Cramming for tests is not a good strategy

node-1.text: Infinitive Phrase = an infinitive + modifiers or complements. Functions as a noun/adjective/adverb

node-2.text: To subsidize child care is very expensive

node-1.text: Absolute Phrase = Noun or Pronoun + a participle

node-2.text: Their faces beaming, they collected the prize.

node-3.text: Did I use my resources effectively?
Did I make a difference to someone?
Did I reach out to anyone?
Did I reach out to anyone?
Did I make a difference to anyone?
How many commandments did I break?
Did I talk with each of my children?
Did I tell them "I love you."?
Did I learn or teach anything?

node-0.text: Fifty Years of systems thinking for management
Be Mindful of the Questions You Ask Yourself

node-1.text: The Importance of Questions: The questions you ask yourself directly impact your perspective in overcoming challenges.

node-2.text: There is a BIG difference between strong questions and weak questions.

node-1.text: Strong Questions: They drive you to find a solution. They help you to grow.

node-3.text: How must I think outside the box here?
How can I successfully overcome this?
How can I make this better?
How can I do this smarter?
What can I do to turn this around?
What is the hidden opportunity here that I am not seeing?
What is great about this situation that I hadn't noticed?
What is the best solution here?
What is it about this that can make me stronger?

node-1.text: Weak Questions: They keep you where you are. They limit your possibilities and potential.

node-3.text: Why does life seem to be working against me?
Why do I have such rotten luck?
Why am I so inadequate and incapable?
Why does this always happen to me?
Why do I always do dumb things?
